website_summaries.verdict: The Tarantula from La Sportiva generally satisfied wearers for being a beginner-friendly rock shoe. It is also acknowledged in the areas of surface traction and fit. That said, this product might not be the best there is for crack ascenders. Nonetheless, the La Sportiva Tarantula has what it takes to give wearers hours upon hours of climbing satisfaction, no matter their skill level.
pros: It is a highly recommendable product for beginners, according to several of those who have climbed in it
This climb-focused piece of footwear from La Sportiva grips like a king, say a handful of senders who have bought it
The La Sportiva Tarantula (men’s and women’s) fits like a glove, say a handful of senders who have used it numerous times
A blogger who has purchased the Tarantula says that it is such an affordable rock climbing shoe
The La Sportiva Tarantula is immensely comfortable, according to professional reviewers
Footwear critics swear by its incredible longevity
cons: The way it handles cracks is lackluster at best, according to a gear pundit who has tested it
An expert who has sent in the shoe multiple times is not too impressed with its middling sensitivity

customer_reviews.title: The Tarantula is an excellent shoe for Beginner - Intermediate levels
customer_reviews.text: If you're a newb to the climbing world (like myself), look no further than this shoes. The Tarantula is an excellent shoe for Beginner - Intermediate levels. The rubber is super sticky, tuff, the shoes strong (you can feel the support), the tips is precise and offers great control, and they're pretty comfortable too. They're technical enough to not hold you back as you learn the basics and get more daring. I don't know what else to say other than they're great and that I've heard a lot of climbers say the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoes, but the fit is too tight
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Shoes take time to break in because they are leather. They are perfect. Changing it to 5 stars from my original 4 stars. Very nice shoes, but the fit is too tight. I am a 10.5 shoe size and bought a 43.5, and they kill my legs when I climb.
customer_reviews.author: Ruven Pinkhasov

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe, disparity in fitment/sizes.
customer_reviews.text: The product is amazing, the sizing chart on the product box and shoe label indicate that it is a full size smaller than what the amazon fitment guide provides. If you use the fitment guide, realize that this shoe is a full size smaller than what the amazon guide says it will be equivalent to. Otherwise, the shoe, itself, is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: these are great. I say they "fit as expected" meaning that ...
customer_reviews.text: First pair of climbing shoes here, and let me tell you, these are great. I say they "fit as expected" meaning that I wear a US13, and they are not too tight. I could have gone a bit smaller, because they aren't probably as tight as a climbing shoe should be, but since they're my first pair it's nice for them to not be too aggressive. I primarily climb gym/granite, and they work well for both smears and crystals. For a beginner shoe, definitely would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe! I wear a size 7 street shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! I wear a size 7 street shoe and I ordered 36.5 europe or 4.5 US. I don't think it translates correctly on the size chart provided on amazon. They fit great, very snug which is exactly what I need. I have the right amount of toe curl for climbing. Im a beginner to intermediate climber. I can't usually wear the shoes longer than just on the route I climb. The straps allow quick and easy on/off and ability to tighten shoes wonderfully. I like the color but a little more dull than I expected them to be. The rubber is fantastic and I feel very comfortable on small foot holds.
customer_reviews.author: drpalmer1

customer_reviews.title: Digs into my achilles, can't even walk!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it was just the pair I got or what, but the heel angle is really steep; there was a cavern of space behind my heel and the upper dug in to my achilles. Other than that they seemed alright for comfort and fit - I just have a hard time believing that most people can find this comfortable at all?!
customer_reviews.author: K. Mudge

customer_reviews.title: Fit me perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended these shoes by a friend, but was hesitant to buy because of the price. I've never bought climbing shoes before, let alone in European sizing, but after cross-referencing many reviews and looking at sizing charts online, I decided to take the plunge. Shoes came as expected and fit perfectly. Mind you, these aren't a super aggressive climbing shoe, which I like as a beginner, but definitely made all the difference and worked amazing right off the bat. I have kind of wide feet, but despite that these fit snug and not too tight. I'll probably be buying another pair of these in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Good starter shoe
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of climbing shoes and I've used them a couple times. I've worn high quality Evolve shoes before that were much more tacky and rigid. These are great for a new climber in a gym, I don't know how long they would last on a natural rock wall.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Harper

customer_reviews.title: Good rock climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good rock climbing shoes. Nice and secure- tight-fitting. Climbing/bouldering shoes are not meant to be "comfortable." They're supposed to be really tight and not worn for long periods of time. Therefore, although I rated that they can be worn comfortably for an hour or less, that's the way these shoes are supposed to be. They're supposed to feel like they're two sizes too small. The quality seems good, but I've only worn them about 6 times so I can't speak for durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: product came as advertised
customer_reviews.text: purchased a usa 8.5 and the fit was true. I have used these twice now at the climbing gym, the first few climbs the shoes felt a little slick on the wall but after they were roughed up a bit held a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am still a pretty new climber--I do indoor bouldering--but I am very happy with these shoes, as I expected after looking at other reviews. They are way more comfortable than the rentals I was previously wearing though they are still tight and thin enough to give me good flexibility with my feet. This is pretty surprising to me because I have wide feet. I think if someone had narrower feet they might want them a little more snug perhaps. But the rubber is good for gripping holds and the heel has been particularly helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle McKay

customer_reviews.title: Starter to medium shoes, positive for Morton’s foot.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these shoes. It took me two purchases to find the correct size, but finally got it. I felt like they are amazing for indoor climbing, but not great for outdoor. They heals strong as I learned how to climb, but the one, first time I climbed outdoors, you could tell how soft they were. Also an amazing shoe for those dealing with Morton’s foot.
customer_reviews.author: LWoods

customer_reviews.title: But I'll take it over the painful tightness of the other shoes I have tried
customer_reviews.text: I am new to climbing. I am typically a size 13-14. I started getting worried bc I literally could not find ANY shoes that fit! Finally! I tried these (Size 15) and they fit! They are a little tight. But I'll take it over the painful tightness of the other shoes I have tried. I only wish there was a cheaper option. I was hoping to get something in the $50 range for my first shoes! Either way, I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Size and Quality iffy
customer_reviews.text: The soles were poorly glued on and my right foot sole quickly tore... I would not recommend this to a beginner because ordering bouldering shoes online is very risky. Going to an actual climbing gym or place that sells these shoes would be a way better option if you have the luxury because you can try them on.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Shoe Climb Good. Real Good.
customer_reviews.text: OMG. I can now climb like Spider-Man. Well Spider-Man if he looked like fat Thor.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Boyd

customer_reviews.title: the rental shoes were comfortable and met my needs
customer_reviews.text: Since I started rock climbing, the rental shoes were comfortable and met my needs...or at least I thought. The Tarantulas give me more of an ability to grip with my feet and fit snugly. It's taking my climbing to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for the price. Sizing is accurate in EU.
customer_reviews.text: For my first pair of climbing shoes they are great! Im only climbing in a gym so I can't tell how they are holding on outside.. About the size- I usually wear 44 EU, and that what I ordered. They fit well, but if you want more edging - take half size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Orel

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Just started climbing and I really love the way these fit. Definitely a good purchase. I would recommend them to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son based on other reviews. He was not disappointed, says they're great (order 1/2 size bigger based on other reviews)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe of the gym!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great and run true to size. I ordered my size women 8 and I could have ordered a half size small. After two hours of climbing my feet felt great! My feet did smell as reported by other reviews and they had a green tint from the dyed leather. Very pleased with the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: wendy welch

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than the size chart says
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. A bit smaller than the size chart states but they're unlined and stretch. Good shoes
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Fine beginner shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fine beginner shoes but after 1 trip outside the soles began to take some significant damage in the front
customer_reviews.author: Cmb

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: A little tight in the toe area nut will more than likely stretch out. Nice shoes
customer_reviews.author: Kristina M. Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit half size down!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a womens 9.5 and I went down a size to a 8.5 which is a 41 M EU. The material on the back of my heel felt too rough so I did where socks when I climbed in these for the first time. I'm a beginner V0 status and love the velcro release!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes. They would be perfect if my big ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoes. They would be perfect if my big feet would fit in them. I should have known better than to try to buy shoes online, when knowing my feet are difficult to fit.
customer_reviews.author: sean r dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, tight at first, now fits like a glove
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for a Novice
customer_reviews.text: Decent beginner shoes, good value for the price. Personally wish I had gone with something more aggressive.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit exactly as siz d. Very comfortable. Glad I ditched my evolves.
customer_reviews.author: Lovemyhistory

customer_reviews.title: those are great beginners shoes
customer_reviews.text: those are great beginners shoes, but it's quite hard to get a size that fits in the first trial. I would recommend coming up with a customized size chart for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Heitor Arakawa

customer_reviews.title: These ROCK!
customer_reviews.text: Very Comfortable fit! The only thing I need to do is spread my toes when I put them on so that I don't tighten them too much on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Malkowski

customer_reviews.title: size down
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 6.5-7(w) in regular shoes but sized down. They're tight but my toes aren't curled up (just right, no pain). I expect they'll stretch a bit as they're leather, making them perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jellyfish

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great rock shoes so far in terms of fits. Will get on the walls tonight.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Chang

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I should of grabbed a size smaller, but for now I simply wear socks. No worries.
customer_reviews.author: Remy Perez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: they were too large. Most rockclimbing shoes run small, these run not true to size but large.
customer_reviews.author: knifetogo

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner climber and these are my first pair of shoes. Overall I'm very happy with them. The only complaint, if you can call it that, is that I got them a size too big, not wanting to get them too small, but kiosk said I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Robinson

customer_reviews.title: The TarantuLace is the same style and 10x more comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I returned these because they were a little uncomfortable. The TarantuLace is the same style and 10x more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Seidler

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great! They run about 1 to 1.5 small. I didn’t see other reviews about this and wanted to help the next shoppers out.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J House

product_meta.title: La Sportiva S.p.A. Tarantula Men
product_meta.description: La Sportiva Tarantula Climbing Shoes Multifunctional climbing shoe ideal for beginners and instructions walls. Quick lacing velcro, standard fit. Suede Leather Upper Constructed using a suede leather upper, the La Sportiva Tarantula Climbing Shoes ensure the perfect balance of structure and stretch. Designed to provide the right amount of support for uncompromising climbs this upper ensures a glove-like fit. The fabric conforms to the shape of the foot to provide a perfect fit that minimises in shoe-slippage; because a precise fit is necessary when climbing. Added leather in the toe box ensure protection from knocks and scrapes ensuring your feet remain protected at all times whilst rubber in the back ensures your heel is always locked in place. The antiperspirant padded tongue makes shoes easier to pull on and off and eliminates creasing allowing the shoe to look newer for longer. Lastly, an innovative closure system consisting of two velcro straps that pull in the opposite direction ensure a locked-down fit for added midfoot support. LaSpoFlex Midsole The midsole of the Tarantula Climbing Shoes is low in profile to save on weight and increase underfoot feel. The Laspoflex midsole is 1.8mm thick to ensure a level of cushioning which doesn't compromise on sensitivity. The specialised midsole incorporates prehensile in the anterior to increase edging capability and sensitivity so you feel changes underfoot without experiencing discomfort. The midsole is designed to ensure added adaptability so you can tackle any climb with complete confidence. FriXion Outsole Ideal for beginners, the outsole of the Tarantula Climbing Shoes features grippy yet hardwearing FriXion RS. The 4mm outsole has been added to ensure enhanced durability and grip allowing your feet to respond to all types of terrain. This ultra sticky compound provides maximum performance as you climb from rock to rock; it is also just as sticky on plastic as it is rock allowing the shoe to be used
